13:00.race_name: Spa Motors Hereford Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Chase

runners.comment: Two wins at Plumpton 2024; mixed form since; chance on his C&D third in October
runners.name: Born At Midnight
runners.spotlight: Two wins in eight days at Plumpton in March 2024 (3m1f, soft); mixed form since, one of his best runs being when third over C&D in October (good to soft); chance on that run.

runners.comment: Won three over hurdles; best chase run when 66-1 second over C&D last time; interesting
runners.name: Ithaka
runners.owner: K P Marsh Plastering & Interiors Ltd
runners.spotlight: Three-time hurdle winner; ran his best race over fences by a long way when 66-1 second in a four-finisher handicap over C&D last time (good to soft); interesting on that run.

runners.comment: Won two chases in 2023; pulled up both starts in 2025; wind op since; should fare better
runners.name: Heva Rose
runners.spotlight: Lightly-raced 9yo; won two mares' handicap chases in 2023, but was pulled up on both starts last year; has since been given wind surgery so should fare better, although has been off for 339 days.

runners.comment: Won two handicap hurdles in 2024; some fair form over fences; engaged 1.30 Fontwell Sunday
runners.name: Innisfree Lass
runners.spotlight: Won two 3m handicap hurdles at Southwell in 2024; bits of fair form over fences, but was pulled up with a sinus problem at Uttoxeter in November; engaged 1.30 Fontwell Sunday.

runners.comment: UK point winner; yet to win under rules; needs to improve on recent runs; on a good mark
runners.name: Marys Fortune
runners.spotlight: UK point winner (2m4f, good to soft); has yet to win under rules and needs to improve on her last two runs but is on a good mark now.

runners.comment: 8yo maiden; 3 fair runs when last out in 2024, including chase debut 2nd; now 6lb lower
runners.name: Just In A Bit
runners.spotlight: Lightly-raced 8yo maiden; three fair runs when last seen out in 2024, on final start finishing runner-up at Worcester on chase debut (2m7f, good); goes on soft ground and quite interesting after his long break having been dropped 6lb.

runners.breeder: Haras De Saint Voir Sca & Mr Joel Denis
runners.comment: Newton Abbot winner in June and back to form when second last time at Windsor; a possible
runners.name: Illogical Logic
runners.spotlight: Newton Abbot winner in June (3m2f, good); has since been pulled up on a couple of occasions but better run when second at Windsor last time (3m, good to soft); a possible.

runners.comment: 6-20 over fences, latest at Wincanton last month; put up 7lb but should be competitive
runners.name: Lightonthewing
runners.spotlight: Has a good record over fences winning six of his 20 races, the latest at Wincanton last month when left clear at the second last; conditions suit and although up 7lb has won off higher marks in the past.

runners.comment: Unexposed 6yo; has shown a modicum of ability in a bumper and over hurdles; chase debut
runners.name: Tongaknoxie
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 6yo; has shown a modicum of ability in a bumper and over hurdles; could go well on his chase debut.

runners.comment: Winning hurdler; third to Lightonthewing over fences last time; chance on 8lb better terms
runners.name: Tuscan Rose
runners.spotlight: Has won two staying hurdles on soft/good to soft; best effort over fences when 9l third to Lightonthewing at Wincanton last time and could turn the tables on 8lb better terms.

runners.comment: Winning Irish pointer; last of three at Leicester on chase debut (2m); 3m1f should suit
runners.name: Lynsey Larue
runners.spotlight: Winning Irish pointer; ordinary form over hurdles; hard to know what she achieved when last of three in a 2m handicap chase at Leicester on her first run over fences; step up in trip should suit.

runners.breeder: Mrs L & Mr J Grandchamp Des Raux
runners.comment: Won two chases two seasons ago; far third over 2m5f here last time; each-way chance
runners.name: Martalmixjac
runners.spotlight: Won twice over fences two seasons ago (2m3f/2m6f; good/heavy); several decent races since then including when third over 2m5f here last time; each-way chance, but this perhaps far enough for her.

13:30.race_name: Blackmore Building Contractors Novices' Hurdle (Novices' Champ Hdl Series Qualifier) (GBB) (Div I)

runners.comment: Did it comfortably on hurdle debut at Southwell; could have plenty more left in the tank
runners.name: Looping dArc
runners.owner: Mrs J Fowler & Mrs T Brown
runners.spotlight: 8l second to useful prospect on debut in bumper at Newbury (2m, good to soft) in November and went one better in maiden hurdle at Southwell (2m, good to soft) last month; did it comfortably last time and could have plenty more left in the tank; strong claims under a 7lb penalty.

runners.comment: Won over C&D then third of three in hot little novice at Aintree; respected under penalty
runners.name: Race To Base
runners.spotlight: Point and bumper winner who scored easily over C&D (good) in November on second hurdle start; last of three at Aintree (2m1f, soft) since but that was still a positive performance in a hot little race and it's likely that this will take less winning; respected under 7lb penalty.

runners.comment: Displayed ability in points but tailed off at triple-figure odds on both hurdle runs
runners.name: Ahanaglogh
runners.owner: De La Haye Lewis Newman Lennon Appleby
runners.spotlight: Displayed ability in points but tailed off at triple-figure odds on both hurdle runs and he'll be of greater interest over further in handicaps.

runners.comment: Took step forward on second start but it was still a long way short of what's needed today
runners.name: Boston Savr
runners.spotlight: Took a step forward when eighth of ten at 125-1 at Haydock (1m7f, good) recently on his second start but that's still a long way short of the required standard today.

runners.comment: Won on the first of his two bumper starts; could have a part to play on hurdle debut
runners.name: Glancing Jack
runners.spotlight: Won with something to spare on debut in bumper here (2m, good to soft) in December 2024; first run since when fifth in good bumper at Worcester (2m, good) in October; could have a part to play now sent hurdling.

runners.comment: Might have won at Taunton but for a final-flight stumble; he's in with a chance
runners.name: Guardami Ancora
runners.spotlight: Runner-up over C&D (good) in November on second start and got closer to the target when occupying the same position at Taunton (2m, good) last month, when he might have won but for a final-flight stumble; chance.

runners.comment: H'dle debut form reads very well in today's context; didn't see out 2m3f here subsequently
runners.name: Loaded And Locked
runners.spotlight: Point (3m, soft to heavy) and bumper (2m, good to soft) winner whose fourth of 13 in a hot novice hurdle at Warwick (2m, good to soft) in November reads very well in today's context; merely third when odds-on here (2m3f, good to soft) since but didn't see out the trip; key player.

runners.comment: No threat in either bumper and well beaten on both hurdle starts
runners.name: Lootenay
runners.owner: Moorland Racing & Menzies A M Ltd
runners.spotlight: No threat in either bumper and well beaten on both hurdle starts.

runners.breeder: A J & Mrs J Ward & G Wragg
runners.comment: Well beaten at 150-1 over C&D on last month's rules debut
runners.name: Triple Haych
runners.spotlight: 13l second of five on debut in British maiden point but pulled up next time and well beaten at 150-1 over C&D on last month's rules debut.

runners.comment: Retains potential but makes hurdle debut with others higher up the pecking order
runners.name: Western Cross
runners.spotlight: 1l second to Loaded And Locked on debut in bumper at Worcester (2m, good) in October; merely ninth of 14 here (2m, good) since; retains potential but makes hurdle debut with others higher up the pecking order.

runners.comment: Backed at big prices but soundly beaten eighth of 14 on debut at Wetherby on Boxing Day
runners.name: Ciao Bellisima
runners.spotlight: Backed at big prices but soundly beaten eighth of 14 on debut at Wetherby on Boxing Day (2m3f, soft; 22-1); lots of improvement is needed.

runners.comment: Unable to threaten when sixth at triple-figure odds in her two maiden hurdles
runners.name: Glancing Back
runners.owner: Emma Bishop Racing Club & Mrs Mj Arnold
runners.spotlight: Unable to threaten when sixth at triple-figure odds in her two maiden hurdles (2m, good) and others are readily preferred.

runners.comment: Two French bumper wins; brings potential to British debut & she's one to be interested in
runners.name: Lady Magic
runners.spotlight: Readily made all in French bumper (1m4f, good) last May and did the same again later that month (1m4f, soft); she brings potential to this British debut and is one to be interested in.

runners.comment: Went close in juvenile hurdle on British debut; might not be far away
runners.name: Donegal
runners.spotlight: One from 13 on the Flat in France; went close on British debut in juvenile hurdle at Doncaster (2m, good to soft) last month; came clear of the third last time and and might not be far away now taking on older horses.

14:00.race_name: Blackmore Building Contractors Novices' Hurdle (Novices' Champ Hdl Series Qualifier) (GBB) (Div II)

runners.comment: Made all by 6l over C&D last month; leading claims under penalty if confirming promise
runners.name: Vol Royale
runners.spotlight: Point winner who was dropped back in trip and showed improved form to make all by 6l over C&D (good to soft) last month; leading claims under 7lb penalty if confirming that latest promise.

runners.comment: Third on British debut at Exeter and could settle better in a first-time hood; considered
runners.name: Aguellid
runners.spotlight: Fourth in warm 3yo hurdle at Auteuil (2m2f, very soft) in September 2024 and returned from long absence to finish third at Exeter (2m, good to soft) 56 days ago; could settle better in first-time hood; one to consider.

runners.comment: Bumper runner-up in 2023 & won a point next time; however, things haven't worked out since
runners.name: Cooler Than Me
runners.spotlight: Bumper runner-up in 2023 and won a point next time; however, things haven't worked out since; pulled up/tailed off on his two hurdle starts.

runners.comment: Things may click at some point but he's been well beaten over hurdles on both starts
runners.name: Cote dAnge
runners.spotlight: Things may click at some point but he's been well beaten over hurdles on both starts (2m, good/good to soft) and a transformation is needed.

runners.comment: Placed in both points but soundly beaten/pulled up on first two hurdle starts
runners.name: Could Be You
runners.spotlight: Placed in both points but soundly beaten on hurdle debut at Lingfield (2m3f, good to soft) and pulled up at Chepstow (2m, good to soft) since.

runners.comment: Has shown some ability but not enough to suggest he'll be winning this
runners.name: Harbour Light
runners.spotlight: Showed some ability in a bumper and on last month's hurdle debut (C&D) but not enough to suggest he'll be winning this.

runners.comment: 60,000euros 3yo, but well beaten at 50-1 on his debut in a bumper at Chepstow
runners.name: Kenobi
runners.spotlight: 60,000euros 3yo whose dam was a French hurdle winner; however, he was well beaten at 50-1 on his debut in a bumper at Chepstow (2m, good to soft).

runners.comment: Fourth in two of his bumpers; sizeable step forward is needed on hurdle debut
runners.name: Lord Virginia
runners.spotlight: Bumper form features a couple of fourth-place finishes; this brother to 2m4f hurdle winner Don Virginia (RPR 128) is open to improvement but a sizeable step forward is necessary on hurdle debut.

runners.breeder: S C E A Ecurie Haras De La Rousseliere
runners.comment: Runner-up in bumper here last April but a long way below that level subsequently
runners.name: Lovis De Sceaux
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in bumper here last April but a long way below that level subsequently, including in maiden hurdles here on last two starts.

runners.comment: Useful on the Flat and brings potential to this hurdle debut; one to watch in the betting
runners.name: Lyric
runners.spotlight: Well beaten last May on sole Flat start for this yard; however, he showed considerable promise in that code previously and brings potential to this hurdle debut; interesting to see how he goes in the betting.

runners.comment: Third here on two of his three starts and he holds each-way claims once more
runners.name: Peters Last Deal
runners.spotlight: Third here (2m, good to soft) in the first of his two bumpers and 14l third of eight here (2m3f, good) on hurdle debut in November; holds each-way claims once more.

runners.comment: Fair maiden on the Flat but soundly beaten over C&D on both completed hurdle starts
runners.name: Raging Al
runners.spotlight: Fair maiden on the Flat but soundly beaten over C&D (good/good to soft) on both completed hurdle starts and others are preferred.

runners.comment: Has shown some ability but others have more substance to their form
runners.name: Daring To Dream
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on debut in bumper at Taunton (2m, good to soft) last April and she's also shown some ability on her two hurdle starts (2m, good to soft), but others have more substance to their form.

runners.comment: Progressive at an ordinary level on Flat; every chance he'll make a hurdler; not ruled out
runners.name: Both Of Us
runners.owner: Mrs H Watson & Mrs Carol Lee
runners.spotlight: His autumn progress on the Flat for George Boughey came at an ordinary level but he won three times (1m4f/2m) and there's every chance he'll make a hurdler; not ruled out on first run since changing hands for 20,000gns.

14:30.race_name: CB Protection And Security Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.breeder: Miss D Quigley & Mrs S OToole
runners.comment: Won on handicap/chase debut at Wincanton and could take a 6lb rise in his stride
runners.name: Noahsgreatrainbow
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner (1m7f, good to soft) who showed improved form when winning by 6l on last month's handicap/chase debut at Wincanton (2m4f, soft); this unexposed 7yo could take a 6lb rise in his stride.

runners.comment: Won over hurdles on recent reappearance; contender if taking to fences at first attempt
runners.name: Soldierofthestorm
runners.spotlight: Made it three from 12 over hurdles when winning on his reappearance at Catterick (2m3f, good) a fortnight ago; has also won on soft ground here; could have a part to play if taking to fences at the first attempt.

runners.comment: Easy win at Leicester on third chase start and a 7lb rise may not stop him this afternoon
runners.name: Rodney
runners.spotlight: Two-time hurdle winner for Kerry Lee (2m3f/2m, soft) who was in front when falling at the final fence on chase debut at Bangor (2m1f, good) in October and bounced back from a lesser run with an easy win at Leicester (2m, good) a fortnight ago; a 7lb rise may not stop him this afternoon.

runners.comment: Promising third at Chepstow on chase debut and could continue to progress; possible player
runners.name: The Winslow Boy
runners.spotlight: Novice hurdle winner (2m, good to soft) who showed improved form when third at Chepstow (2m, good) in November on his chase and seasonal debut; this lightly raced 7yo could continue to progress and he's bred to be suited by the step up in trip; possible player.

runners.comment: Tailed off on chase debut at Warwick; needs to leave that latest performance miles behind
runners.name: Gold For Alec
runners.spotlight: On a handy mark on his hurdle form and he ran well in that sphere in October; however, well beaten next time and tailed off on last month's chase debut at Warwick; needs to leave that latest performance miles behind.

runners.comment: Beaten on last 11 starts but went close at Ludlow latest; in the mix if backing it up
runners.name: Pepe Le Moko
runners.spotlight: Beaten on his last 11 starts but he's dropped down the weights and returned to form with a near-miss at Ludlow (2m4f, good to soft) last month; has won on soft/good to soft; in the mix if backing up his last run.

runners.comment: Two wins last year, including here, but he's failed to shine on his last three starts
runners.name: Zestful Hope
runners.spotlight: Won here (2m3f, good to soft) last February and also at Huntingdon (2m4f, good; easily) in October; just 3lb above that latest winning mark but he's failed to shine on his last three starts.

runners.comment: Two chase wins last season; in front when falling five out on return; could be in shake-up
runners.name: Edeiffs Rock
runners.spotlight: Two chase wins (2m5f/2m7f, good to soft/soft) during last season's first campaign over fences and she was in front when falling five out on last month's reappearance at Wincanton (2m4f, soft; favourite), having jumped to the right throughout; could be in the shake-up granted a clear round.

runners.comment: French hurdle/chase runner-up but tailed off/pulled up on his two British starts
runners.name: Just Forty
runners.spotlight: 5yo who was runner-up over hurdles/fences in France; however, tailed off in novice hurdle on British debut and pulled up at 33-1 in handicap chase at Uttoxeter on New Year's Eve; plenty to prove.

runners.comment: Third on both chase starts and could have more to offer over fences; each-way claims
runners.name: The Magus
runners.spotlight: Won on handicap hurdle debut at Chepstow (2m3f, good) in April and he's finished third on his two chase starts (2m5f/2m7f, good); this lightly raced 6yo could have more to offer over fences and holds each-way claims if conditions suit (unproven on slow ground).

runners.comment: 3m point runner-up who could be a big improver up in trip for his handicap/chase debut
runners.name: I Aint Your Mate
runners.spotlight: Went close in a point (3m, yielding) in April 2024 and changed hands for £120,000 that May; took a step forward when fourth in maiden hurdle at Wincanton (1m7f, soft) in February when last seen and he could be a big improver now up in trip for his handicap/chase debut; watch the betting.

15:00.race_name: Green Dragon Hotel Novices' Limited Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: 0-9 but was a clear second at Ludlow (2m5f) last time and she's respected at this new trip
runners.name: Briery Butterfly
runners.owner: Mrs H Plumbly J Trafford K Deane S Holme
runners.spotlight: Well-bred mare who is 0-9 but she's been going the right way in handicaps and was a clear second at Ludlow (2m5f, good) in November; 4lb higher after a short break but she has plenty of stamina in pedigree and is open to more progress at this new trip; respected.

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras Du Saubouas
runners.comment: Made a winning handicap debut at Fontwell yesterday and is the type to progress further
runners.name: Mr Griffiths
runners.spotlight: Well held in his three qualifying runs (2m3f/2m4f) but made a winning handicap debut at Fontwell (3m2f, soft) yesterday and is the type to progress further; respected if turning out quickly.

runners.comment: 0-12 but was fair fourth at Wincanton (3m) and he's unexposed as a stayer; not ruled out
runners.name: Vengeance
runners.spotlight: Pulled up on stable debut at Exeter in November but that was after a long absence and he bounced back with a respectable fourth behind Happy Returns at Wincanton (3m; tongue-tie added) last month; record is now 0-12 but he's on a reduced mark and is unexposed as a stayer; could go well.

runners.comment: Newton Abbot winner who was a fair fourth over C&D last month; in the mix
runners.name: Bredon Hill Dart
runners.owner: R W And Mrs Mitchell D V Gardner
runners.spotlight: Has a patchy profile but he won a Newton Abbot handicap (3m2f, good to soft) in June and was a fair fourth over C&D (soft) last month; needs to kick on again to defy this mark but he's been generally progressive in handicaps and still has potential as a stayer.

runners.comment: Easy win at Wincanton (3m) last month; only a modest fourth at Fontwell yesterday
runners.name: Happy Returns
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the 13th attempt with an easy win at Wincanton (3m, good to soft) last month; only a modest fourth behind Mr Griffiths at Fontwell (3m2f) yesterday, however.

runners.comment: Lightly raced 6yo but she made mistakes last time and needs to raise her game
runners.name: Shorten Sassy
runners.spotlight: Low mileage but beaten 10l, 27l and 12l over C&D (good/soft) in her three handicaps; mark is sliding but she made mistakes last time and needs to raise her game.

runners.comment: Made the breakthrough with a stylish win at Uttoxeter; big player again up 7lb
runners.name: Bollin Thou
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 8yo who made the breakthrough when justifying favouritism at Uttoxeter (3m, good soft) on New Year's Eve; up 7lb but that was stylish success and he's open to more progress; strongly respected with Sean Bowen booked again.

runners.breeder: John Goodman & The Late Owen Brennan
runners.comment: Won at Leicester (2m4f) in November but has failed to fire in two starts since
runners.name: Jewel Eyed Judy
runners.spotlight: Found improvement when a well-backed winner at Leicester in November (2m4f, soft) but has failed to fire in two starts since, latest at Fontwell (3m2f) yesterday.

runners.comment: Handicap newcomer but he needs a transformation on this switch to a staying trip
runners.name: Getaway Sam
runners.spotlight: Unseated rider at first flight on stable/hurdle debut in October and a well-beaten outsider on next three outings; still unexposed and now goes handicapping but he needs a transformation on this switch to a staying trip.

runners.comment: Down the field in all six runs including when tailed off on handicap debut at Kempton
runners.name: Harksman
runners.spotlight: Has finished down the field in all six runs including when tailed off on handicap debut at Kempton (3m, good) in November; still early days but can only be watched until he shows more encouraging signs; hood worn last time is removed.

runners.comment: 0-10 but he ran well at Wetherby last time and could be dangerous if he can back that up
runners.name: Smart Bucks
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent ten-race maiden but he ran well upped to 3m when fourth of 16 in a Wetherby handicap (soft; cheekpieces added) last month; that was more like it and he could be dangerous if he can back that up.

runners.comment: Has struggled in all ten starts and he's a long way out of the weights again
runners.name: Dontworrywegotthis
runners.spotlight: Has struggled at big prices in all ten starts including when pulled up in a Doncaster handicap (3m, good to soft) last month; long way out of the weights again and it's easy to look elsewhere.

runners.comment: Point winner; showed promise in bumper/over hurdles before absence; fair return; improve
runners.name: Sweet Honey B
runners.spotlight: Good point win in 2023 and later showed promise in a bumper and over hurdles; missed two full years after but she wasn't disgraced on her handicap debut at Uttoxeter (2m, soft) in December and may well show more today now back at a more suitable trip and eligible for this lower grade.

runners.comment: Won Uttoxeter maiden hurdle in November; minor form since, in handicaps on last 2 starts
runners.name: Gower Spirit
runners.spotlight: 28-1 winner of Uttoxeter maiden (2m4f, heavy) in November but minor efforts since, pulled up and then well held in handicaps at Ascot and Chepstow (first-time cheekpieces, now discarded); down in grade, though, so can't be dismissed.

runners.comment: Won 3m Punchestown hurdle last June; modest since and sold £1,200 in November
runners.name: Ballerina Boxer
runners.owner: Mike Harris Racing & Nikki Evans Racing
runners.spotlight: Beat a big field at Punchestown (3m, good to yielding) last June but had some ordinary results after and was sold for £1,200 in November; achieved her win in a hood and it's refitted for the first time since July; likely other days, even so.

runners.comment: Well held in early handicaps but step up to 2m4f suited when keeping-on 2nd latest; solid
runners.name: Feet On The Ground
runners.spotlight: Beaten 12l+ in first three handicaps but the step up in trip suited when she was a keeping-on runner-up at Southwell (2m4f, good to soft) last month; up 2lb but solid to go well again.

runners.comment: Promising bumper debut; nothing special hurdling but may do much better now handicapping
runners.name: Noble Grace
runners.spotlight: Promising bumper debut at Cheltenham last spring; nothing special in three qualifying runs over hurdles but she goes handicapping off a lowly mark and yard has a good strike-rate this season; market can guide.

runners.comment: Some promise on 2m handicap debut but off since last March and now makes yard debut
runners.name: Jessie Jump Jet
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced mare who showed some promise on her 2m handicap debut at Huntingdon last February but was pulled up the following month; left Tom Lacey since and likely to need the run following a layoff.

runners.comment: Course winner over hurdles in 2023 but struggling to recapture form following an absence
runners.name: Fay Ce Que Voudras
runners.spotlight: Course winner over hurdles in 2023 but she missed a chunk of her career after and has not yet found her old form, over fences or back hurdling; some reservations with cheekpieces added.

runners.comment: Handy mark relative to C&D form last spring; failed to complete in two runs since break
runners.name: Make Sunshine
runners.spotlight: Has dropped to a handy mark relative to C&D form last spring but she fell on her return from a break then pulled up back here before Christmas; tongue-tie refitted but others are of more interest.

runners.comment: Modest start to hurdle career; more promise in October; clear C&D win since; back up 10lb
runners.name: Jamaicaine
runners.spotlight: Has had some significant breaks throughout career and she didn't get off to a great start over hurdles but her close Fontwell fifth was more promising and she came well clear over C&D (good to soft) last month; back up 10lb but still on a lowly mark; has every chance.

runners.comment: Beat a big field over 2m2f in late 2023; off for 2 years and finished remote on comeback
runners.name: Harthill
runners.spotlight: Off the mark when beating a big field at Stratford (2m2f, soft) in late 2023 but she wasn't seen again for two years and finished remote at Huntingdon three weeks ago; may well need another run or two.

runners.comment: Involved in handicap hurdles and chases, latterly over 2m4f in November; had wind op since
runners.name: Time Was
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner; thereabouts in handicap hurdles and chases, latterly at Market Rasen (2m4f, good to soft) in November; had wind surgery since and is entitled to be on the premises again despite going back up 4lb.

runners.comment: Won her only completed chase start, in November, but pulled up latest and 0-8 over hurdles
runners.name: Formel Park
runners.spotlight: Winner of her only completed chase start, at Sedgefield (about 2m, soft) in November, but she was pulled up next time and reverts to hurdles (0-8) and a longer trip with something to prove.

runners.comment: Modest form in a handful of hurdle starts, including two handicaps; new yard
runners.name: Lady Fortune
runners.spotlight: Minor form in a handful of hurdle starts, including in two handicaps; needs plenty more for new yard.

runners.comment: Still a maiden but close up over 2m-2m4f of late; return to good to soft may not be ideal
runners.name: Prairie Queen
runners.spotlight: Not yet off the mark but she's been running well from the front in handicaps at about 2m to 2m4f (on good and quicker) of late; has a race in her but the return to good to soft may not be ideal.

16:00.race_name: Hereford Ladies Day Saturday 7th March Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB)

runners.comment: Sixth foal; dam twice-raced sprint maiden; a watching brief is advised on debut
runners.name: Arizona Moon
runners.spotlight: Sixth foal; dam twice-raced sprint maiden, closely related to useful 6f-1m winner; wears a tongue-tie on debut and a watching brief is advised.

runners.comment: Runner-up in a point/bumper and sets the standard for the rest to aim at
runners.name: Cool Customer
runners.spotlight: Went close on sole point start (3m, good to yielding) and also finished runner-up on bumper debut at Southwell (2m, good to soft) last month; sets the standard for the rest to aim at.

runners.comment: Sold for £100,000 after winning Irish point on debut; firmly in calculations
runners.name: Loch Ness Pineau
runners.spotlight: Won on debut in Irish maiden point (3m, good) in October and subsequently sold for £100,000; new trainer enjoys plenty of success in bumpers and he's firmly in calculations on this first rules start.

runners.comment: Off mark at fifth attempt in Irish points; new trainer has an excellent record in bumpers
runners.name: Roi Du Roume
runners.spotlight: Off the mark in November at the fifth attempt in Irish maiden points (3m, yielding); subsequently sold for 25,000euros; new trainer has an excellent record in bumpers and he could play a leading role on his rules debut.

runners.comment: Promising third at Southwell on debut (Cool Customer second); open to improvement
runners.name: Thatll Be Oxo
runners.spotlight: He has a useful pedigree and showed promise when third of nine at 4-1, beaten about 8l, on last month's debut at Southwell (2m, good to soft; Cool Customer second); open to improvement and could have a part to play.

runners.comment: Sold for £120,000 since winning Irish mares' maiden point; could be a serious force
runners.name: Britway Belle
runners.spotlight: Won Irish mares' maiden point (3m, yielding) on debut in October and subsequently changed hands for £120,000; takes on males on bumper debut but could be a serious force, especially if strong in the betting.

runners.comment: 40-1 when 10l tenth of 14 on last month's debut at Ludlow; needs significant step forward
runners.name: Dont Call Me Sue
runners.spotlight: 40-1 when 10l tenth of 14 on last month's debut at Ludlow (2m, good to soft); the hood is retained; needs a significant step forward.

runners.breeder: Tom Symonds Simon Davies Robert Buckler
runners.comment: Dam Listed bumper winner; trainer can ready a bumper runner first time
runners.name: Faiths Song
runners.spotlight: £48,000 3yo; sixth foal; half-sister to 2m hurdle winner The Winslow Boy (RPR 121); dam Listed bumper/2m3f hurdle winner; trainer can ready a bumper runner first time and she could go well on debut.

runners.comment: Debut fifth gives her something to build on but others have more substance to their claims
runners.name: Mysti Meadow
runners.spotlight: 14-1 and raced alone on the inner in the home straight when fifth of 14 on last month's debut at Ludlow (2m, good to soft), beaten about 6l in that mares' contest; that run gives her something to build on but others have more substance to their claims.

runners.comment: Won Irish mares' point by 10l last May; then sold for £41,000; could give a good account
runners.name: Pigeon Forge
runners.spotlight: Built upon debut third (3m, good to yielding) when winning Irish mares' maiden point by 10l last May (3m, good); sold for £41,000 in July; makes rules debut with new yard going well and she could give a good account.

runners.comment: 125-1 when down the field on debut at Ludlow (2m, good to soft) last month
runners.name: Simply A Dancer
runners.spotlight: 125-1 when down the field on debut at Ludlow (2m, good to soft) last month; the hood is retained; it's probably best to look elsewhere.

runners.comment: Won off 6lb higher over C&D last January; returns to Lingfield for first time since
runners.name: Michaelas Boy
runners.spotlight: Wouldn't be the pick on recent bare form but was hindered by a wide trip last time; defied a 6lb higher mark over C&D last January and returns to Lingfield for first time since; resurgence possible.

runners.comment: Record of 211 over C&D includes a win in this race last year; interesting back here
runners.name: Master Of My Fate
runners.owner: Ms Janelle Cao Ross Harmon & Partner
runners.spotlight: Brings a doubt over current form, having been well below par in both outings this winter; however, record of 211 over C&D includes a success in this race 12 months ago; interesting back here.

runners.comment: Consistent efforts last month, beaten only 1l in higher grade over C&D latest
runners.name: Almaty Star
runners.spotlight: Record of 3-18 on AW; consistent efforts last month, beaten only 1l in Class 3 contest over C&D latest; 5lb below last winning mark and holds a fighting chance back down in grade.

runners.comment: C&D win in November; ran creditably last time; remains well treated on peak form
runners.name: Diomed Spirit
runners.spotlight: Got back on the scoresheet in November, registering a second win over C&D; ran creditably at Chelmsford since and remains well treated on historical data (has defied current mark).

runners.comment: Won maiden on debut for new yard but has regressed in two handicaps since
runners.name: Coronado King
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced; justified favouritism in Wolverhampton maiden (6f) on debut for new yard but has regressed in two handicaps since, latest dropped to 5f; wears hood for first time since 2024.

runners.comment: Consistent filly who is 424211 in C&D handicaps; very solid chance back here
runners.name: Toolatetonegotiate
runners.spotlight: Consistent filly whose success in December took her record in C&D handicaps to 424211; creditable third upped to Class 4 at Southwell since; very solid chance off unaltered mark back here.

runners.comment: Has done all her winning in Class 6 events over 6f/7f; enough to prove
runners.name: Bint Havana Gold
runners.owner: Alan & Christine Bright And John Henwood
runners.spotlight: Has done all her winning in Class 6 events over 6f/7f, the most recent in October; not in the same form since and has enough to prove in this scenario; returns to 5f for first time since 2024.

13:10.race_name: Midnite, Building The Future Of Betting Handicap

runners.breeder: Mount Coote Stud And Anthony Warrender
runners.comment: Successful at Lingfield and Southwell since upped to 2m; further progress is plausible
runners.name: Nunc Est Bibendum
runners.spotlight: Has justified favouritism at Lingfield (by a neck) and Southwell (easily) since upped to 2m, shedding her maiden status; may well defy a 9lb rise for last time, with further improvement very plausible.

runners.comment: Ideally suited by Southwell, being 6-12 there and only 1-20 elsewhere
runners.name: Young Endless
runners.spotlight: Good second over C&D when bidding for a four-timer but has taken a couple of backward steps since; win record shows that he's ideally suited by Southwell, being 6-12 there and only 1-20 elsewhere.

runners.comment: Disappointing last time but may rebound; otherwise knocking on the door in Flat handicaps
runners.name: Prince Quattro
runners.owner: Ursa Major Ltd & Hicky Parmar Racing
runners.spotlight: Disappointing last time (12.5f) but could well rebound; otherwise knocking on the door in Flat handicaps, suggesting he can add to his hurdles wins; beaten only a whisker at Newcastle in most recent 2m attempt.

runners.comment: Needs improvement on her Flat figures and lacks recent match practice
runners.name: A Tickatickatiming
runners.spotlight: Bumper/hurdle winner; 0-5 on Flat, needs improvement on bare figures in this sphere and lacks recent match practice having been absent for ten months; best watched unless the market speaks favourably.

13:40.race_name: Best Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Unexposed 4yo but he flopped on his comeback at Chelmsford last month; bit to prove
runners.name: Charging Bull
runners.spotlight: Showed promise when sixth on Kempton debut (6f, AW) in December 2024, but he returned after a year off with a disappointing run at Chelmsford (last of five) last month; now goes back up in trip but that was a heavy defeat last time and he needs to bounce back.

runners.comment: 0-12 but sets standard on his best form and this drop to 6f is worth exploring; respected
runners.name: Tenbob Tommy
runners.spotlight: 12-race maiden who can take a strong hold but he was runner-up in three consecutive starts on turf/Polytrack (1m) in the autumn; finished down the field in last two runs (7f), but he sets the standard on his best form and this drop to 6f is worth exploring; shortlisted.

runners.comment: 0-7 but he hasn't had much luck recently and was an eyecatcher over C&D latest; respected
runners.name: Alasrae
runners.spotlight: Seven-race maiden but he hasn't had much luck for current yard and was an eyecatching fourth in a C&D handicap 12 days ago; that form puts him in the picture and he still has potential at this trip; strongly respected with blinkers added.

runners.comment: Well-related newcomer who needs a close look in the market
runners.name: Comprador
runners.spotlight: Brother to 5f/6f 2yo winner Trillium (including Group 2; RPR 109), half-brother to three winners including American Kestrel (Group-placed 6.5f 2yo; 105) and Mohawk King (6f-8.5f including  2yo/AW/US dirt; 102); dam Group-placed 7f 2yo winner (105); interesting newcomer; needs a close look in market.

runners.comment: Struggled in both runs last month and remains best watched for now
runners.name: Pedros Dream
runners.spotlight: Made a low-key start at Kempton (6f) last month and was tailed off again at Wolverhampton (5f) on Boxing Day; remains best watched for now.

runners.comment: Well held on recent Wolverhampton debut and needs plenty of progress dropped in trip
runners.name: Tactical Blitz
runners.spotlight: 70,000gns yearling; 5-1 on recent Wolverhampton debut (7f, AW) but he got outpaced at a crucial stage and finished sixth of seven; should be more streetwise this time but he needs a transformation on this drop in trip.

runners.comment: Well held in both runs last month and minor handicaps will be more like it
runners.name: No Drama Mama
runners.spotlight: Well held at big prices in two runs last month, the latest over C&D (last of five); has plenty to find and minor handicaps will be more like it.

14:10.race_name: Create Your Bet Builders At Midnite Classified Stakes

runners.comment: Won at Southwell eight days ago and runner-up at Lingfield on Saturday; in form
runners.name: Call Glory
runners.spotlight: Ended a long losing spell with Southwell handicap success (6f) eight days ago; running-on second in Lingfield classified event (7f) on Saturday; remains in form.

runners.comment: Went close in similar event at Wolverhampton last week; fighting chance
runners.name: Autumn Angel
runners.spotlight: Has shown most AW form on Tapeta; went close in classified race at Wolverhampton (6f) last week; fighting chance provided she's as effective back on Polytrack.

runners.comment: Ties in closely with Autumn Angel on latest effort; big player at the weights
runners.name: Beauzon
runners.spotlight: Most wins at Wolverhampton; ties in closely with Autumn Angel on classified running there last week; big player at the weights and has won over C&D (four years ago).

runners.comment: Two classified wins in 2025; inconsistent but has the ability to figure
runners.name: Lynwood Lad
runners.spotlight: Scored twice at this level in 2025 and wasn't disgraced, despite wide trip, at Chelmsford (6f) on reappearance; inconsistent but has the ability to play a leading role.

runners.comment: Neck wins at Wolverhampton since returned to AW; the form is solid for the level
runners.name: Midnight Call
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 5yo; maiden prior to recording neck wins at Wolverhampton (6f handicap, 5f classified) since returned to AW; the form is solid for the level; respected.

runners.comment: String of three duck eggs reflect a major dip in her form
runners.name: Miss Moonshine
runners.spotlight: Made the frame several times early last year but a string of three duck eggs reflect a major dip in her form since; losing run goes back to March 2024.

runners.comment: Sole attempt in C&D classified contest resulted in her only win; new headgear
runners.name: Sarabi
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent but sole attempt in a C&D classified contest resulted in her only win, and she wore first-time blinkers; interesting back in same scenario in new headgear.

runners.comment: Inconsistency demonstrated by the duck eggs that flank his second over C&D
runners.name: World Of Darcy
runners.spotlight: Far from consistent since completing a turf hat-trick in October 2024, as demonstrated by the two duck eggs that flank his second over C&D in December; not solid.

14:40.race_name: Always Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Handicap

runners.comment: Scored over C&D most recently, narrowly beating Chloe's Courage; respected
runners.name: Jackson Street
runners.spotlight: Has a modest strike-rate but scored over C&D most recently (narrowly beat Chloe's Courage) and warrants respect kept to same scenario; still favourably treated on peak form.

runners.comment: Went close over C&D on penultimate start; hindered by wide trip latest
runners.name: Roman Emperor
runners.spotlight: Still seeking first handicap win but went close in similar event over C&D on penultimate start and has good claims on that form; hindered by wide trip at Chelmsford four days ago.

runners.comment: Proved resurgent over C&D last time but otherwise an inconsistent maiden
runners.name: Mighty Ruler
runners.spotlight: Proved resurgent with close fifth over C&D last time and has possibilities provided he builds on that effort; however, otherwise an inconsistent sort and still a maiden.

runners.comment: Course regular who holds a fighting chance provided he's in top form
runners.name: Mount Mogan
runners.spotlight: Course regular who gained most recent win off current mark last March; none too consistent since but holds a fighting chance provided this is one of his better days.

runners.comment: Close second to Jackson Street over C&D last time; major contender
runners.name: Chloes Courage
runners.spotlight: Form since wearing blinkers features an account-opening win at Chelmsford and close second to Jackson Street over C&D; major player in new headgear (switches to visor from blinkers).

runners.comment: Failed to get home over 8.5f last time; wears first-time eyeshield
runners.name: Supernova Steps
runners.spotlight: Record of 1-18 reflects her limitations; however, should benefit from the drop back in trip, having failed to get home over 8.5f most recently; wears first-time eyeshield.

runners.comment: Capable of being involved but remains a longstanding maiden
runners.name: Capallcliste
runners.spotlight: Best effort last year when second on Lingfield AW in August (back from layoff); capable of being involved but remains a longstanding maiden; returns from three-month break.

runners.comment: Six-race maiden who brings the worst form
runners.name: Mishys Star
runners.spotlight: Six-race maiden who brings the worst form; yet to make the frame.

15:10.race_name: Bet £10 Get £40 With BetMGM Classified Stakes

runners.comment: Has shown positive signs by finishing second in two of his last three starts
runners.name: Celtic John
runners.spotlight: Remains a maiden but has shown positive signs by finishing second in two of his last three starts, latest over C&D; possibilities.

runners.comment: Still a maiden and his form claims are far from solid
runners.name: Duke Orsino
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden and his form claims are far from solid.

runners.comment: Further 5lb drop allows him into this 0-50 classified, which may help
runners.name: Huntly Lodge
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 5yo; has dismal form figures in handicaps but a further 5lb drop allows him into this 0-50 classified, which may help.

runners.comment: Respectable fourth over C&D on return from break last time; frame possibilities
runners.name: Monks Mead
runners.spotlight: Losing spell goes back to 2023; respectable fourth over C&D on return from break last time and again has frame possibilities.

runners.comment: On a long losing run and lacks recent match practice
runners.name: Mr Trick
runners.spotlight: On a long losing run, lacks recent match practice and may need further than 1m these days; opposed.

runners.comment: Maiden who has lost her early consistency; others preferred
runners.name: Princess Pw
runners.spotlight: Maiden who has lost her early consistency; two poor efforts since returned to AW; others preferred.

runners.comment: Has plenty of course form but last two efforts don't bode well
runners.name: Rainbow Sign
runners.spotlight: Has plenty of course form but last couple of efforts (both over C&D) don't bode well, nor does his modest strike-rate.

runners.comment: Largely sound results at Lingfield since August; successful in C&D handicap last time
runners.name: Royal Jet
runners.spotlight: Largely sound results at Lingfield since August; opened his AW account in C&D handicap most recently; solid and respected.

runners.comment: Good second in C&D handicap when last seen ten weeks ago; major player
runners.name: Taskheer
runners.spotlight: Form over C&D includes a classified win last February and good second in handicap when last seen ten weeks ago; major player.

runners.comment: Maiden who has inconsistent form since August
runners.name: Unknown Journey
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden and has inconsistent form since August; others have stronger claims.

runners.comment: Remains a longstanding maiden; below par at Lingfield on Saturday
runners.name: Valadero
runners.spotlight: Placed numerous times but remains a longstanding maiden; below par in 7f classified event at Lingfield on Saturday.

15:40.race_name: Win £250,000 With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap

runners.comment: Capable mare but some inconsistency has crept in; others preferred
runners.name: Renesmee
runners.spotlight: Capable mare but some inconsistency has crept in; contrasting performances the last twice, winning well at Chelmsford (1m2f) then failing to beat a rival at Southwell (1m).

runners.comment: Took a good hold and faded at Kempton last week when bidding for hat-trick
runners.name: Foreseen
runners.spotlight: Took a good hold and faded into sixth at Kempton last week when bidding for a 1m hat-trick; however, has possibilities if settling better, with the October/December wins not forgotten.

runners.comment: Has something to prove dropped in trip on debut for new stable
runners.name: Kingkeer
runners.spotlight: Campaigned over middle distances for Hughie Morrison and has lacked consistency since sole win; joined new connections for 7,000gns; something to prove dropped in trip.

runners.comment: Scored over C&D in November; creditable efforts here since; solid chance
runners.name: H Key Lails
runners.spotlight: Scored three times last year, most recently over C&D in November; couple of creditable efforts here since, keeping-on fifth over 7f latest; solid chance back up in trip.

runners.comment: Got up in the final stride to collar Way To Dubai over C&D on reappearance
runners.name: Repertoire
runners.spotlight: Got up in the final stride to collar Way To Dubai over C&D on reappearance, recording first win since 2023 and showing that he retains plenty of vitality aged ten; should remain competitive, back up just 1lb.

runners.comment: Nabbed by Repertoire on the line over C&D last time; fighting chance off same mark
runners.name: Way To Dubai
runners.spotlight: Still seeking first British win after many attempts; however, currently in a consistent vein of form and nearly bagged a C&D event nine days ago (nabbed by Repertoire on the line); fighting chance off same mark.

runners.comment: Completed a turf double at Lingfield in August; poor form back on AW since
runners.name: Comedian Leader
runners.spotlight: Completed a double on the turf course (7f/6f) at Lingfield in August but not in anything like the same form since returned to AW; revival is needed.

runners.comment: Disappointing over C&D on Saturday but a resumption of progress is possible
runners.name: Dandy Khan
runners.spotlight: Record of 4-8 for current stable, all wins at Lingfield (7f/1m); disappointing over C&D on Saturday but a resumption of progress is far from impossible; receives weight all round, upped in class.

17:00.race_name: Midnite A Next Generation Betting App Apprentice Handicap

runners.comment: C&D scorer who arrives in good nick; she ought to be in the shake-up again
runners.name: Grand Duchess Olga
runners.spotlight: C&D scorer who arrives in good nick, not enjoying the smoothest of passages when sixth of 11 over C&D 16 days ago; she ought to be in the shake-up.

runners.comment: Failed to beat rival in a pair of handicaps at Haydock for his current yard in late summer
runners.name: Legacy Power
runners.spotlight: A fair 2m scorer for Andrew Balding but he failed to beat a rival in a pair of 1m6f handicaps at Haydock for his current yard in late summer; lots more is required after a break with eyeshields fitted.

runners.comment: Good fourth of six in 2m h'cap here six days ago; he can go well again for current yard
runners.name: Fascinating Shadow
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark for his current handler at Lingfield (2m) in December and has continued in good nick, caught wide when fourth of six in 2m handicap here six days ago; he can go well again.

runners.comment: Still a maiden and he came in last of eight in Ffos Las h'cap when last seen out in July
runners.name: V Power
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden and he came in last of eight in 1m6f Ffos Las handicap when last seen out in July; he needs to take a big step forward.

runners.comment: Has cut little ice on all his three runs; hooded for handicap debut; lots more required
runners.name: Urban Warrior
runners.owner: W Enticknap B Ralph And Partner
runners.spotlight: Has cut little ice on all his three runs (with Charlie Appleby for debut) and beat just one in 1m Kempton novice in November; hooded for his handicap debut; significantl improvement required.

runners.comment: Won at Southwell latest having conceded first run to the second; big shout under 4lb pen
runners.name: Moon Over The Sea
runners.spotlight: Multiple course scorer who resumed winning ways in 1m3f Southwell handicap eight days ago, doing especially well given he conceded first run to the second; he merits serious consideration under a 4lb penalty for his in-form yard.

runners.comment: Comes here out of sorts, beating one in h'cap here four weeks ago; others are preferred
runners.name: Alex The Great
runners.spotlight: A dual 2m AW scorer early in 2025 but he comes here out of sorts, beating just one in 2m handicap here four weeks ago; others are preferred.

runners.comment: Good second over C&D 16 days ago; can make her presence felt again off an unchanged mark
runners.name: Zooks
runners.spotlight: Scored at Ffos Las (1m6f) in July and continues in good order, second of 11 over C&D 16 days ago; she can make her presence felt again off an unchanged mark.

runners.comment: Below-par sixth of 12 in 1m6f Southwell handicap 24 days ago; more is needed
runners.name: Blue Siam
runners.spotlight: Enters calculations on the form of her good Newcastle third in October but she came in a below-par sixth of 12 in 1m6f Southwell handicap 24 days ago; she needs to get back on track.

runners.breeder: The Rumble Racing Club - White Chocolate
runners.comment: In good form until ninth in 1m4f handicap here 37 days ago; he's the sort to bounce back.
runners.name: Havachoc
runners.spotlight: In good form without winning until just ninth of 11 in 1m4f handicap here 37 days ago; he's the sort to bounce back.

runners.comment: Turf winner at 6f in October; ready success at Southwell for new yard; up 5lb; can go well
runners.name: Grey Horizon
runners.spotlight: Won on turf at Catterick (6f; first-time visor, retained) in October and has found new reserves on Tapeta for this yard since, appreciating the easier task back over 6f when never seriously threatened at Southwell recently; up 5lb but likely to go well again.

runners.comment: Runner-up to improvers on both AW starts; Tapeta debut
runners.name: Espona Bay
runners.spotlight: Unraced on Tapeta but he did well from off the pace against progressive winners at Chelmsford and Kempton (6f) on his two AW starts, latterly against one who received weight and won her next two; off since October but should have no trouble finding a race.

runners.comment: Two siblings have won on AW/dirt; minor 6f promise; handicap debut; bred to stay further
runners.name: Black Rock Beauty
runners.spotlight: Two siblings have won on artificial surfaces; some minor 6f promise over C&D on second start and he should find his feet in handicaps in due course, although pedigree suggests he will come into his own over further.

runners.comment: Best at 5f so far, determined Newcastle winner latest; up 2lb; this test looks realistic
runners.name: Golden Havana
runners.spotlight: Best form at 5f so far, giving a determined display to hold on at Newcastle (first-time blinkers, retained) four weeks ago; up just 2lb and this test looks more realistic than previous attempts at 6f.

runners.comment: Thereabouts in 3 sprint handicaps under B Loughnane; competitive from low draw
runners.name: Blindfold Games
runners.spotlight: Thereabouts in three sprint handicaps under Billy Loughnane in December, looking suited by the return to 6f over C&D latest and better drawn today; shouldn't be far away.

runners.comment: Signs of ability on debut; fair 4th to well-treated winner on yard debut; should improve
runners.name: Tafah
runners.spotlight: Ran green but signs of ability on Bath debut (extended 5f) last July; some minor late promise at Southwell (6f) recently on return from a break for new yard, behind one who has won twice since; dropped 2lb; should do better.

runners.comment: Short in betting for in 2 of first 3 runs; dropped out on handicap/AW debut; wind op since
runners.name: Faithful Dream
runners.spotlight: Quite short in the betting for two of his three qualifying runs on turf but easy to back on AW/handicap debut at Kempton (6f) in October when dropping right out; had wind surgery since; no surprise if he fares better.

runners.comment: Useful pedigree; minor form in 3 runs; can improve now handicapping but drawn widest
runners.name: Life After Love
runners.spotlight: Useful pedigree and both siblings won on Tapeta; big prices and well held so far (hooded latest, not today) but of interest now handicapping, even though her draw isn't helpful; market can guide.

runners.comment: Won on 6f handicap debut; close up in two of his 6f runs since; needs to settle better
runners.name: Far Too Fizzy
runners.spotlight: Won on handicap debut at Chelmsford (6f) in October; has kept on surprisingly well, considering how hard he pulled, in two of his subsequent 6f runs (over C&D latest), but in desperate need of relaxing early.

runners.comment: Minor form so far, including on turf handicap debut last July; off since; other days
runners.name: Lina Codina
runners.spotlight: Minor form in a handful of starts and was never involved on her handicap debut at Thirsk last July; withdrawn after getting loose before the start in December; likely other days.

18:00.race_name: Best Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Novice Stakes

runners.comment: Readily scored at Southwell 15 days ago; she's a player with more progress on the cards
runners.name: All Moonshine
runners.spotlight: Twice-raced Oasis Dream filly who built on her debut promise when readily landing 7f novice at Southwell 15 days ago; concedes weight all round but she's a player with more progress on the cards.

runners.comment: Only seventh of ten in 7f Newcastle handicap 23 days ago; needs to bounce back
runners.name: Counting Cards
runners.spotlight: Capable of fair form but he's been lightly raced and went freely when only seventh of ten in 7f Newcastle handicap 23 days ago; needs to bounce back.

runners.comment: Some promise when sixth in C&D novice 13 months ago; has fitness to prove for new yard
runners.name: Hammal
runners.spotlight: 7-1, hinted at promise when sixth of ten on his belated debut in C&D novice 13 months ago for Stuart Williams; starts out for a new yard here with his fitness to prove.

runners.comment: Off 14 months before third at Chelmsford 32 days ago; form franked so he needs considering
runners.name: Oceans Five
runners.spotlight: Twice-raced son of Bated Breath who took a big step forward after 14 months off when third of ten in 1m Chelmsford novice 32 days ago; that form has been franked so he needs considering.

runners.comment: Green when a debut seventh of eight at Southwell 15 days ago; can take a step forward now
runners.name: Splinterwood
runners.spotlight: 20-1 and green when a debut seventh of eight in 7f Southwell novice 15 days ago; this son of Due Diligence can take a step forward now.

runners.comment: Off 15 months but encouraging third for new yard at Southwell latest; enters calculations
runners.name: Thequietman
runners.spotlight: A fair ex-Irish maiden for Joseph O'Brien in 2024; off 15 months but (hooded) made an encouraging start for new yard when third of eight in 7f Southwell novice last month; he must enter calculations.

runners.comment: Very good third at Newcastle 23 days ago when set a lot to do; holds very good form claims
runners.name: They All Know Me
runners.spotlight: Fair and consistent maiden who comes here on the back of a very good third of ten in 7f Newcastle handicap 23 days ago when set a lot to do; he holds very good form claims.

runners.comment: Last of ten in 9.5f novice here three weeks ago; easy to look elsewhere
runners.name: Miss Helena
runners.spotlight: Failed to beat a rival in a pair of bumpers before coming in last of ten in 9.5f novice here three weeks ago; easy to look elsewhere.

18:30.race_name: Win £250,000 With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap

runners.comment: Beaten a short head over 6f here after a break; back up 2lb on return to 7f
runners.name: Bear Rock
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in four of six AW starts, including when beaten a short head over 6f here (11-1; first run back from a break) last month; respected, but could be vulnerable over this extra furlong now back up 2lb.

runners.comment: Beaten favourite (fourth) over 6f here latest; returning to 7f should aid cause; possible.
runners.name: Bella Bisbee
runners.spotlight: Winning start for yard over C&D early last month and ran well (runner-up) under a penalty the following week; beaten favourite over 6f here on Boxing Day since but returning to this trip should help; possibilities.

runners.comment: Three 6f wins at Lingfield; creditable 4th latest but trip query back over 7f
runners.name: Mart
runners.spotlight: Three 6f wins at Lingfield but 0-2 over 7f; did take a step back in the right direction when a close fourth at Lingfield (6f; 9-2) on New Year's Eve but still has a trip query.

runners.comment: C&D fourth (stable debut) on penultimate start; flopped since; easing mark in cheekpieces.
runners.name: Arnaz
runners.spotlight: Sole win at Brighton (7f) in May 2024; lacked pace to stake a claim over C&D on first start for this trainer, and reportedly was unsuited by front-running at Lingfield latterly; mark is easing and cheekpieces are fitted.

runners.comment: Notched first win for this trainer over C&D (off 4lb lower) latest; player.
runners.name: The Caribbean
runners.spotlight: First win for this trainer over C&D (off 4lb lower) just over a month ago; bit more required from a wide draw in this Class 4 contest, but likely has a role to play assuming that has reignited the spark.

runners.comment: Third to Nacho Nacho Nacho over C&D 16 days ago; relatively unexposed over 7f; chance.
runners.name: Flowstate
runners.spotlight: Off the mark over 7f at Newcastle (AW) on penultimate start and since finished a close third to Nacho Nacho Nacho over C&D; still relatively unexposed over 7f, so there's every chance he can give that rival more to think about today.

runners.comment: C&D winner (first-time visor) before said to have run too free when disappointing since
runners.name: Nacho Nacho Nacho
runners.spotlight: Made most when winning over C&D (first-time visor; Flowstate a close third) in December; said to have run too free when disappointing from this 2lb higher mark at Southwell since; needs to bounce back but is handily drawn to attack.

runners.comment: Three 7f AW wins; 0-3 for this trainer; nothing yet to suggest that his turn is near
runners.name: Adelaide Bay
runners.spotlight: Three 7f AW wins for Jane Chapple-Hyam but he hasn't done enough in three runs for this yard to suggest that his turn is near, despite being only 2lb above his latest winning mark.

runners.comment: C&D winner off 4lb lower on penultimate start; raced wide when well beaten next time.
runners.name: Harbour Vision
runners.spotlight: Veteran stablemate of Bella Bisbee; first win for 13 months when poaching an unassailable lead over C&D (off 4lb lower) before Christmas; raced wide when last of ten back here subsequently but others make more appeal.

runners.comment: Comfortable winner of this last year; less competitive lately but stable going well
runners.name: River Wharfe
runners.spotlight: Comfortable winner of this last year and has added three more since, including over 8.5f here (same mark) in October; less competitive lately, but stable has made a good start to the year and not dismissed.

19:00.race_name: Read Meg Nicholls' Blog At betmgm.co.uk Handicap

runners.comment: Fifth in an AW novice last time; interesting up in trip on h'cap debut with headgear tried
runners.name: Because We Can
runners.spotlight: Has shown signs of promise in maiden/novice company, last time finishing 2.75l fifth of ten at Kempton (6f); quite interesting up in trip with visor tried on handicap debut.

runners.comment: Best run when fifth in an AW maiden (7f); not so good on h'cap debut (6f); better expected
runners.name: Slack Bob
runners.owner: The Old Etonian Racing Syndicate II
runners.spotlight: Best run when fifth in a Chelmsford maiden in November; perhaps found 6f too sharp when fourth on handicap debut at Lingfield last time; likely to do better back over 7f.

runners.comment: Hasn't shown a great deal in maiden/novices or in two handicaps and improvement needed
runners.name: Prancy Peer
runners.spotlight: Didn't show a great deal in maiden/novice company and no improvement in handicaps on last two runs; more needed.

runners.comment: 0-6; best run when 2nd in Redcar nursery (6f); AW should suit and a possible back at 7f
runners.name: Sailor Batt
runners.spotlight: Six-race maiden; best run when second in a Redcar nursery in September (6f, good to soft); hood tried when sixth at Haydock last time; related to AW winners, so this surface should suit, and with hood retained could go well.

runners.comment: Improved with cheekpieces and going handicapping and could go well on her AW debut
runners.name: Pimentel
runners.spotlight: Improved with cheekpieces since going handicapping, winning at Brighton and finishing good second at Yarmouth; could go well on AW debut.

runners.comment: C&D winner in November but disappointing over 1m a week later; contender back at 7f
runners.name: Crown The Future
runners.spotlight: Won over C&D on handicap debut in November; race may have come too soon when only fifth at 8-15 at Newcastle when stepped up to 1m next time; definite chance back at 7f.

runners.comment: Modest efforts, including over 6f on h'cap debut; needs to improve for headgear and 7f
runners.name: Spirit Of Mara
runners.owner: Richard Fahey Ebor Racing Club Ltd
runners.spotlight: Modest efforts so far, including over 6f on handicap debut here last time; needs to improve back over 7f and for the addition of cheekpieces.

runners.comment: Dead-heated for first place when stepped up to 7f last time; this looks stronger
runners.name: Surgeon Commander
runners.spotlight: Showed improved form when stepped up to 7f last time when dead-heating in a Newcastle nursery (blinkers on for second time); went up just 1lb but this looks a stronger race.

19:30.race_name: Always Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Handicap

runners.comment: Off six months before a below-par ninth of 11 over C&D 16 days ago; others are preferred
runners.name: Pacific Prince
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced sort who returned from six months off with a below-par ninth of 11 over C&D 16 days ago; others are preferred.

runners.comment: C&D winner; good third at Southwell latest; merits serious consideration off same mark
runners.name: R P McMurphy
runners.spotlight: Consistent sort who scored over C&D last month and came in a good third of nine (first-time cheekpieces) in 1m Southwell handicap six days ago; merits serious consideration off the same mark with headgear again fitted.

runners.comment: Solid third at Newcastle in November; he's very much one to consider after a break
runners.name: Hows The Guvnor
runners.spotlight: It's now 17 runs since his last success but he posted a solid third of 12 in 1m Newcastle handicap in November; he's very much one to consider after a break.

runners.comment: Landed handicap here ten days ago; up 2lb but a player for yard among the winners
runners.name: Scenario
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 4yo who built on earlier promise for her current yard to land 9.5f handicap here ten days ago; up 2lb but she's a player for yard among the winners, with relatively few miles on the clock.

runners.comment: Still a maiden and came in a below-form seventh of 11 in Southwell handicap nine days ago
runners.name: Volendam
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden and she came in a below-form seventh of 11 in 7f Southwell handicap nine days ago; she needs to bounce back.

runners.comment: Off 11 weeks before fading ninth in Southwell h'cap nine days ago; can take a step forward
runners.name: Homer Stokes
runners.spotlight: On a losing sequence but he shaped as if the run was needed after 11 weeks off when a fading ninth in 7f Southwell handicap nine days ago; he can take a step forward now.

runners.comment: Solid fifth at Newcastle two weeks ago but folded tamely at Chelmsford yesterday
runners.name: Strobelight
runners.spotlight: Tried in blinkers when a solid fifth of nine in Newcastle handicap two weeks ago; however, folded tamely and trailed home last in the retained headgear at Chelmsford (again over 7f) yesterday; still a maiden.

runners.comment: C&D scorer who got back on track with C&D fifth latest; one for the shortlist
runners.name: Lhebayeb
runners.spotlight: C&D scorer who got back on track when fifth of 11 over C&D 16 days ago; she's one for the shortlist off a 2lb lower mark.

runners.comment: Lightly raced maiden who beat only two in 7.5f Ffos Las maiden in June; handicap debut
runners.name: Paps Of Jura
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced maiden who beat only two in 7.5f Ffos Las maiden in June; returns after a layoff for his handicap debut with lots more required.

runners.comment: Now 0-23 and he came in 11th of 13 in 1m2f Lingfield handicap four weeks ago
runners.name: Faster Bee
runners.spotlight: Now 0-23 and he came in 11th of 13 in 1m2f Lingfield handicap four weeks ago; plenty to prove with a tongue-tie added.

runners.comment: Got off the mark over C&D last January but he's not proved easy to catch right since
runners.name: Dash Power
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark over C&D last January but he's not proved easy to catch right since, finishing a below-par seventh of ten in 1m Southwell handicap 24 days ago; others appeal more.

runners.comment: Course scorer but he comes here under a cloud; needs to take a big step forward
runners.name: Arlecchinos Rex
runners.spotlight: Course scorer but he comes here under a cloud, ninth of 12 in 7f Lingfield handicap three weeks ago; he needs to take a big step forward.

20:00.race_name: Make The Move To Midnite Classified Stakes

runners.comment: Very lowly rated but has made hay in AW classified races in recent days for new yard
runners.name: Eagles Whistle
runners.spotlight: A maiden in Ireland but she's made hay in classified events on last two starts at Newcastle (7f and 1m) for new yard; stayed 1m1f well enough in her home country to think she'll cope with this trip and the main issue is whether she's tough enough to win a third race in four days.

runners.comment: 0-19 but kept on well when 4th in C&D handicap latest; now down in grade
runners.name: Bondi Man
runners.spotlight: Winless after 19 starts but he kept persevering when fourth of nine in a C&D handicap on Boxing Day and another good run looks likely now down to this grade for the first time.

runners.comment: Wide-margin winner of similar C&D race last January; unpredictable since; risky
runners.name: Desiderata
runners.spotlight: Wide-margin winner of a similar C&D race last January but he's unpredictable and refused to race in March; modest show back here on Boxing Day and, although excused a 1m3f defeat at Southwell since, he's risky.

runners.comment: In good form over hurdles; chance on 2025 turf form but 0-7 on AW, including in classified
runners.name: Gemini Man
runners.spotlight: Has been hurdling, winning in August and losing out only narrowly before Christmas; a good spell on the Flat last summer included a 1m1f turf win but he has more to prove on AW form (0-7), including at this level; has run well in headgear, cheekpieces refitted.

runners.comment: Turf winner in 2024; tough times since, including on AW for this yard
runners.name: Newfire
runners.spotlight: Turf winner in Ireland during 2024 but she's had a tough time of it since, including on AW for this yard, and a plunge in her mark has yet to pay dividends.

runners.comment: Hat-trick at about 1m here two winters ago; lightly raced since; quite encouraging latest
runners.name: Pyrrhic Dancer
runners.spotlight: Reeled off a hat-trick at about 1m here two winters ago; also has C&D form; lightly raced since but he fared a lot better in an amateur jockeys' race here last time than he had the time before, when returning from an absence; another step back to form would put him in this picture.

runners.comment: C&D winner two years ago but beaten just one rival in five runs since back from absence
runners.name: Racing Country
runners.spotlight: C&D winner two years ago but he's beaten a total of one rival in five starts for new trainer following an absence; can only watch.

runners.comment: Three AW wins in 2023; ended losing run on turf in August; not at the same level since
runners.name: The Pug
runners.spotlight: Three AW wins in 2023; ended a losing run in a Ffos Las classified (1m2f) last August but he hasn't reached the same level for new yard since, including back in this grade at Southwell last week.

runners.comment: Course winner in 2023; went close in similar C&D race last summer; could be thereabouts
runners.name: Trusty Scout
runners.spotlight: Course winner at this level in 2023; mostly uphill for him these days but his saddle slipped last time out and he did go close in a similar C&D race last summer; not ruled out; often wears cheekpieces but not today.

runners.comment: Two turf wins in 2023; rarely involved since; ran poorly on 2nd start for new yard latest
runners.name: Wrist Art
runners.spotlight: Two turf wins in Ireland in 2023 but rarely involved since and he followed a fair yard debut at Southwell in November with a tame effort there last week; however, he has run well when hooded and a first-time visor could be helpful.

runners.comment: 0-15 but often in the frame; creditable 1m run on Saturday; return to further can suit
runners.name: That Lucas Fella
runners.spotlight: Winless after 15 starts but in the frame several times and he was close to breaking his duck on Newcastle AW (1m2f) in August; runner-up over 1m there on Saturday and return to further should suit; thereabouts.
